metadata.title: CVE-2019-16255 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Ruby through 2.4.7, 2.5.x through 2.5.6, and 2.6.x through 2.6.4 allowscode injection if the first argument (aka the "command" argument) toShell#[] or Shell#test in lib/shell.rb is untrusted data. An attacker canexploit this to call an arbitrary Ruby method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jruby package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2').
